name: Natural: Avoid Nested Programs using STOP and TERMINATE
description: The statements STOP and TERMINATE are counted for every artifact; whenever there are occurences of this statements the artifact is reported as violation.
rationale: The STOP statement is used to terminate the execution of a Natural application. A STOP statement executed anywhere within an application immediately stops the execution of the entire application. TERMINATE stops the execution of the Natural application and also ends the Natural session. It is better to use controlled ending of an application and or session using proper error handling
total: Number of Nested Programs ( read Subprograms)
